nodes.title:
US Family of 6 w/ Income of $150k...

1st Stimulus Check: $4,400
2nd Stimulus Check: $3,600
3rd Stimulus Check: $8,400

Total: $16,400

What if they didn't lose their job/income during pandemic? Not a factor - get the full amount.

How are we paying for this?

Debt, debt, debt... https://t.co/OMTerTiiLl

nodes.title: One definition of inflation is "too much money chasing too few goods." We're borrowing trillions of dollars to send free money to over a hundred million people who never lost their job/income during the pandemic - for a third time. If this doesn't create inflation, nothing will. https://t.co/eFLT2fiKgo

nodes.title:
All of Momentum's outperformance vs. Value since the start of the pandemic last year has been given back after the relative crash over the last few weeks.

The 27% relative drawdown vs. value is the largest ever since the inception of the momentum ETF in 2013.
